title: 103_s50
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Jefferson Commemorative Coin Act of 1993" and includes specifications for the coin. The "Jefferson Commemorative Coin Act of 1993" specifies the issuance of one-dollar silver coins with specific weight, diameter, and composition. The design includes a Jefferson profile and Monticello. The coins are legal tender and bear inscriptions of value, year, and patriotic phrases. The Secretary must obtain silver for the coins from stockpiles established under the Strategic and Critical Minerals Stock Piling Act. The design for the coins will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with the Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation and the Commission of Fine Arts, and reviewed by the Citizens Commemorative Advisory Committee before issuance. Coins minted under this Act will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at a single United States Mint facility. The Secretary is authorized to issue these coins between July 4, 1993, and July 4, 1994. The coins authorized under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value, a surcharge of $10 per coin, and the cost of designing and issuing the coins. Prepaid orders will be accepted at a discount. SEC. 7. General waiver of procurement regulations for goods or services needed for this Act. Compliance with equal employment opportunity laws required for contracts under this Act. SEC. 8. Distribution of surcharges. SEC. 8. DISTRIBUTION OF SURCHARGES.

Surcharges from coin sales under this Act will be paid to the Jefferson Endowment Fund for the first 500,000 coins and to the Corporation for Jefferson's Poplar Forest for all other coins. SEC. 9. AUDITS.

The Comptroller General of the United States can examine books, records, and data related to expenditures under section 8.

SEC. 10. NUMISMATIC PUBLIC ENTERPRISE FUND.

Coins issued under this Act are subject to section 5134 of title 31, United States Code, the Numismatic Public Enterprise Fund.

SEC. 11. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES.

The coin program should be self-sustaining with no net cost to the Numismatic Public Enterprise Fund.
